definitions.definition: to be able to bring back a piece of information into your mind, or to keep a piece of information in your memory:
examples: "Where did you park the car?" "I can't remember."

definitions.definition: to not forget to do something:
examples: Did you remember to do the shopping?

definitions.definition: to be kept in people's memories because of a particular action or quality:
examples: She will be remembered for her courage.

definitions.definition: said when you are talking to someone about something that they used to know but might have forgotten:
examples: We went and had tea in that little café - you remember, the one next to the bookshop.

definitions.definition: to hold a special ceremony to honour a past event or someone who has died:
examples: On 11 November, the British remember those who died in the two World Wars.

definitions.definition: to give a present or money to someone you love or who has provided good service to you:
examples: My Granny always remembers me (= sends me a present) on my birthday.
